Blessing of Unlife.name: Blessing of Unlife
Blessing of Unlife.description:
You attune a creature to the Void, entirely altering how its body reacts to the living world. The creature’s appearance becomes more drab and withered, and they gain the following benefits:

  • Void healing. The target is counted as undead for effects that would heal or harm them, does not take void damage, and is damaged by vitality damage.
  • Immunity to death effects as per the basic undead benefits, as well as disease, paralyzed, and poison.
  • Resistance to bludgeoning damage equal to half their level.

Effect: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-heresy-of-the-whispering-way.spells.Item.7DUEQXxp9OmF6xtl]{Blessing of Unlife (Effect)}

Heightened (9th) You can target up to 6 creatures.

Blessing of Unlife (Effect).description:

Bolster Undead.name: Bolster Undead
Bolster Undead.description:
Your patron infuses the target with necromantic energy. If the target is a living creature, it must attempt a Will save. If the target is a willing undead creature, it gains temporary hit points equal to 2 + half your level until the start of your next turn.

Critical Success The target is unaffected

Success The target cannot regain hit points from vitality magic, and gains a weakness to void damage equal to half your level.

Failure As success, but the weakness increases to your level.

Bone Explosion.name: Bone Explosion
Bone Explosion.description:
You cause the target’s bones to explode within their body, dealing 12d8 piercing damage with a basic Fortitude save and releasing shrapnel into the area around them.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target takes half damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued}.

Failure The target takes full damage piercing damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued}, All creatures in a 10 foot emanation of the target take half damage.

Critical Failure The target takes double damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued}. All creatures in a 10 foot emanation of the target take full damage.

Heightened (+1) The damage increases by 2d8.

Consume Undead.name: Consume Undead
Consume Undead.description:
You siphon the animating energy from an undead creature. The target suffers 4d8 spirit damage to it, and it gets a basic Fortitude save. If the target is an undead minion under your control, it suffers 32 spirit damage instead. In either case, regain hit points equal to half the damage dealt.

Heightened (+1) The amount of damage increases by 1d8, or 8 if the target is an undead minion under your control.

Daywalker.name: 日行者 Daywalker
Daywalker.description:
你重塑了一名自愿不死生物的基本性质，让它看起来像是个同体型，会呼吸的活着的生物。这是物理上的改变，改变的是该不死生物的骨头、肉体，或是虚体外质，并增添新的肌肉或骨骼，甚至头发、牙齿与血液，模拟一名活物的呼吸以及其他的物体生理过程，这些所有用来表明生命的虚假迹象。一名使用日行者的虚体不死生物，在法术持续时间将不再是虚体，它会获得实质的尸身。

与该不死生物交互的生物，可以尝试一次察觉检定（对抗你的法术DC）确认这生命特征的虚假，而一次近距离观察，使用医疗检定，总是能够揭露那是腐肉的事实。

如果该不死生物拥有与其不死本质相关的能力，比如恐怖威压、虚体、阳光弱点、独特的非武装攻击或类似能力，此法术会压制这些能力。它也会压制那些会因该不死生物的碰触触发的能力，比如食尸鬼的@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.N7UV5CZXtcoxDxCF]{食尸鬼热 Ghoul Fever}，但不会压制@UUID[Compendium.pf2e-animal-companions.AC-Features.Item.3mUx8vXEQkiIuBcR]{虚能治疗 Negative Healing}。

升阶 (5环) 你能以30尺内的最多10个生物为目标。

Desecrate.name: Desecrate
Desecrate.description:
You imbue a site with void energy, infusing it into the very ground. Within the area, living creatures get a -3 status penalty to saving throws against void effects. Undead created within the area get a +1 status bonus to attack rolls, AC, saving throws, and skill checks. Additionally, undead within the area get a +1 circumstance bonus to attack rolls, AC, saving throws, and skill checks.

If the area affected by the ritual contains an altar, shrine, or other permanent fixture dedicated to a deity or higher power aligned with undeath, the duration of the ritual increases to 1 year and the area becomes a 40-foot-radius burst centered on the permanent fixture.

This spell counters and dispels the consecrate ritual when cast over an area affected by it, and vice-versa.

Critical Success The desecration succeeds, and it either lasts 10 times as long or covers an area twice the radius. Occasionally, with the favor of a deity or extremely powerful undead, this might produce an even more potent effect, covering a much larger area or making the effect permanent.

Success The desecration succeeds.

Failure The desecration fails.

Critical Failure The desecration fails spectacularly, and the attempt is felt by nearby priests and champions of faiths opposed to undead.

Heightened (+1) The duration increases by 2 hours if there isn’t a permanent fixture.
Desecrate.cost: a vial of unholy water and silver dust worth 20 gp x the spell level

Dirge of Comfort.name: Dirge of Comfort
Dirge of Comfort.description: Allies within the area reduce their @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened} value by 1. Additionally, if an ally within the area is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused}, they may make a @Check[type:flat|dc:10] to remove their confusion.

Hide from Undead.name: Hide from Undead
Hide from Undead.description:
You ward the target against undead creatures, making the target undetected by them. Non-mindless undead creatures can attempt a Will save against your Spell DC to see past the illusion. If the target uses a hostile action, the spell ends after that hostile action is completed.

Critical Success The creature sees past the illusion, and can target you as normal.

Success The creature is aware of your presence, but you remain hidden to them for the spell’s duration.

Failure You remain undetected by the creature.

Heightened (4th) You can instead target up to 10 creatures within 30 feet.

Lichdom.name: Lichdom
Lichdom.description:
You utilize exceptionally potent void, spiritual, and necromantic magics in order to attempt transforming yourself into a lich. The ritual itself is unique to everyone that performs it, but certain paths hold similarities that shape your ritual. Before performing the ritual, you must select a Lich Path you seek to ascend using; it is henceforth referred to as your path, and changes the requirements for your ritual. 

To begin the ritual, you must first perform its Sacrifice, as detailed in your path. This sacrifice often takes a form thematically appropriate to your life and experiences, and rarely needs to be something visually grand. Often, the thing sacrificed is deeply personal and irreplaceable, to the point that its loss may lead to a conflict with your edicts and anathemas. This sacrifice creates a fracture within your soul, allowing the magic of the ritual to begin altering it.

Once the ritual has begun, the ritual must then consume a powerful source of magic, typically an item as listed in the ritual’s cost. This item or source must be of a level equal to or greater than twice the ritual’s level. The item/source is destroyed or drained by the ritual, typically depending on how powerful it is, but does not inherently need to be abhorrent. While many wicked liches may sacrifice a large number of souls to brute force this requirement, a powerful magical item, ley-line, or the blessing of a deity are all equally valid sources for this magical energy. The magical energy provided by this portion of the ritual is used in tandem with your own magic in order to fuel the ascension to lichdom; if it has a trait that matches your lichdom tradition (such as arcane if your spellcasting is arcane), you get a +2 status bonus to the primary check for this ritual.

After this is done and the casting time of the ritual ends, the ritual itself does not conclude. Instead, you have one month to perform the final portion of the ritual: ending your life in a poignant and thematic way as detailed by your path’s ending means. This is by far the most loose portion of ritual, as any number of means and ends can be significant enough to count, and should be discussed with the GM. Should the ritual end before you complete the ending means, the ritual counts as an automatic failure (but not a critical failure), and any items spent are lost. This can be devastating and exceptionally costly, as you will need to provide the sacrifice and the magical source again; however, if you know the ritual was poorly performed, it can provide a method to try again without risking a worse fate.

If any of these requirements are absent, improperly performed, or thematically insignificant, it reduces the degree of success for the primary caster’s skill check to complete the ritual by one level for each missing requirement.

Critical Success As success, but you rejuvenate instantly, appearing over the ritual circle in all your resplendent and necromantic glory.

Success The ritual succeeds, you are destroyed, and your soul flees to your soul cage (or equivalent). You rejuvenate after 1d10 days a full lich, and gain the benefits of the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-heresy-of-the-whispering-way.feats.Item.F1gDdRbJQE4nIApQ]{Lich Dedication} feat immediately. Because you gained them in this manner, you must select the dedication feat at the next opportunity, either as a class feat or a free archetype feat. If you do not have a physical soul cage, you instead appear at a location important to you 1d10 days later, even if you normally would not return after being destroyed.

Failure The ritual fails, you are destroyed, and you are not resurrected. You can still be resurrected by normal means, but may have drawn attention in the afterlife from your failure.

Critical Failure You experience a fate worse than death, becoming a lich shade. Your memories are scattered, but you retain full knowledge why and how your ritual failed. You become an NPC under the GM’s control–perhaps, if you have allies that are willing to help you, you can be returned to flesh through a Wish or similar act of powerful magic. In all likelihood, however, this is where your story ends–bitter, failed, and alone.

Special This ritual is always heightened to half your level if it is lower.
Lichdom.cost: your path’s required soul cage and a magic item whose level is greater than or equal to twice this ritual’s rank

Life Sight.name: Life Sight
Life Sight.description:
Your magic grants you the ability to sense the life force of others. You gain lifesense as an imprecise sense with a range of 20 feet. The sense can distinguish between the vitality energy animating living creatures and the void energy animating undead creatures, much as sight distinguishes colors.

Heightened (+1) The range of your lifesense increases by 10 feet.

Life Siphon (HWW).name: Life Siphon (HWW)
Life Siphon (HWW).description:
Trigger You expend one of your wizard spell slots to cast a spell.

You use some of the spell's magic to heal yourself, regaining 1d8 Hit Points per rank of the spell.

Mastery of Flesh.name: Mastery of Flesh
Mastery of Flesh.description:
You shape the target’s flesh, shaping it for good or ill. If the target is a living or undead creature, you deal 2d6+4 force damage to it, and it gets a basic Fortitude save. If the target is a willing living or undead creature it instead restores that amount of Hit Points.

Heightened (+1) The amount of healing or damage increases by 1d6+2.

Rejuvinating Coalescence.name: Rejuvinating Coalescence
Rejuvinating Coalescence.description:
You coalesce powerful natural magic, empowering a young plant to bloom into a necromantic seed bound to your very soul. During the ritual, life in the area around you withers and dies, its vitality being drained and stored within a single object. Whether the ritual is a success or failure, a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-heresy-of-the-whispering-way.equipment.Item.sjXLVSY2171KKDD8]{Rejuvinating Seed} cannot be created again within one mile of the ritual location for the next year due to the impact it has on the ecosystem.

Critical Success As success, but the ritual has minimal impact on the environment; life gets sick, but does not wither extensively and can recover over the course of a month instead of a year.

Success The @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-heresy-of-the-whispering-way.equipment.Item.sjXLVSY2171KKDD8]{Rejuvinating Seed} is created successfully.

Failure The @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-heresy-of-the-whispering-way.equipment.Item.sjXLVSY2171KKDD8]{Rejuvinating Seed} is not created.

Critical Failure As failure, but the spell backlashes on you, rendering you drained 5. This value reduces by one every 24 hours.
Rejuvinating Coalescence.cost: a sapling or sprout from a plant important to you

Repair Undead.name: 不死修复 Repair Undead
Repair Undead.description:
你的碰触将虚能魔法引导至不死生物身上，治疗它。目标恢复1d8+8生命值。若生物身上有@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{流失 Drained}状态，流失值减少1点。

升阶 (+1) 治疗量增加1d8+8。
Repair Undead.target: 一个拥有虚能治疗的自愿生物

Restore Corpse.name: Restore Corpse
Restore Corpse.description: You grow flesh on a decomposed or skeletonized corpse of a Medium or smaller creature, providing it with sufficient flesh that it can be animated as a zombie rather than a skeleton. The corpse looks as it did when the creature died. The new flesh is somewhat rotted and not fit for eating.

Ritual of Vassallichdom.name: Ritual of Vassallichdom
Ritual of Vassallichdom.description:
You use the immense powers of your own lichdom in order to uplift a willing pupil to vassallichdom, a weaker and more controllable form of your own powers. The process of creating a vassallich is far simpler than creating a normal lich thanks to the power provided. In order to cast this spell, you must be a Lich, and must be the primary caster. The creature being ascended to lichdom must be the secondary caster, and must be willing.

To begin the ritual, the target first imbibes a small portion of your body; preparation does not matter, but it is typically a section of flesh or shavings from your bones. Then, you expend a spell slot of 7th level or higher, creating the necessary crack in the creature’s soul by force. Finally, you expend an additional spell slot of 7th level or higher, unleashing a powerful blast of magic which kills the creature, raising it as a lich and binding its soul to the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-heresy-of-the-whispering-way.equipment.Item.18iP9vXJhI7mr7a9]{Vassalich Soul Cage}, which remains in your possession throughout the ritual.

Critical Success As success, but the creature rejuvenates instantly within the ritual circle in a kneeling position.

Success The creature is destroyed, and its soul flees to the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-heresy-of-the-whispering-way.equipment.Item.18iP9vXJhI7mr7a9]{Vassalich Soul Cage}. The creature rejuvenates after 1d10 days as a vassallich, and gains the benefits of the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-heresy-of-the-whispering-way.feats.Item.ymYPbmqasllMGlaw]{Vassallich Dedication} feat immediately (or gains the vassallich template if it is an NPC). If it gains the benefits of the Vassallich Dedication feat, it must select the dedication feat at the next opportunity, either as a class feat or a free archetype feat.

Failure The ritual fails, and the creature dies.

Critical Failure The creature’s soul is obliterated by the ritual, and cannot be revived without the usage of a Wish or similar magical effect.
Ritual of Vassallichdom.target: 1 willing creature of 11th level or lower, who is also the secondary caster

Sentry Skull.name: Sentry Skull
Sentry Skull.description:
You restore the senses to the severed head of a humanoid creature killed within the last 24 hours, creating a grisly sentinel. The head must be affixed to a pole, spear, tree branch, or other stable object, and the spell ends if the head or its object is moved.

The head has darkvision, can swivel in place to look in any direction, and has a bonus to Perception equal to your spell attack modifier. If you are within 30 feet of the head, you can use an action with the concentrate trait to shift your senses to it, seeing and hearing from its location and gaining the benefit of its darkvision, and you may use its Perception skill instead of your own. While your senses are in the severed head, your body is blind and deaf until you spend a free action to shift your senses back to your own body.

When you create the head, you can imprint a trigger. Once this trigger is set, it cannot be changed. If you are within 30 feet of the head, you immediately know if it is triggered (if you have multiple active sentry skulls, you also know which one was triggered). This awakens you from normal sleep but does not otherwise disturb your concentration. For example, you could have a sentry skull alert you if any humanoid comes into view, if a particular rival approaches, if your guard animal is killed, and so on, as long as it occurs where the severed head can see it.

Heightened (5th) The head now has a range of 1 mile, and a duration of unlimited.

Skeletal Aspect.name: Skeletal Aspect
Skeletal Aspect.description:
You transform yourself into a skeletal version of yourself. While in this form, you gain the undead and skeleton traits. You can Dismiss the spell.

You gain the following statistics and abilities in this form:

  • AC = 17 + your level. Ignore your armor’s check penalty and Speed reduction.
  • Temporary hit points equal to your level.
  • Darkvision 60 feet.
  • Negative Healing.
  • Resistance to cold, electricity, fire, piercing, and slashing damage equal to half your level.
  • A +2 circumstance bonus to saves against death effects, disease, and poison.
  • Intimidation modifier of 6 + your level, unless yours is higher.

Effect: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-heresy-of-the-whispering-way.spells.Item.lOMc8Vzfb9LjDJvQ]{Skeletal Aspect (Effect)}
